===Second Camp established, Notice to Vacate===
+
===Second Camp established, health inspection===
On October 18, a second camp with about about two dozen people was set up on October 18, 2011, primarily because the Frank H. Ogawa Plaza site was running out of room.<ref>{{cite news|last=Alston|first=John|title='Occupy Oakland' takes over a second park|url=http://abclocal.go.com/kgo/story?section=news/local/east_bay&id=8396951|accessdate=October 23, 2011|publisher=KGO|date=October 18, 2011}}</ref>
On October 18, a second camp with about about two dozen people was set up on October 18, 2011, primarily because the Frank H. Ogawa Plaza site was running out of room.<ref>{{cite news|last=Alston|first=John|title='Occupy Oakland' takes over a second park|url=http://abclocal.go.com/kgo/story?section=news/local/east_bay&id=8396951|accessdate=October 23, 2011|publisher=KGO|date=October 18, 2011}}</ref>
â
The [[Alameda County]] Health Department visited the site on October 19, 2011, on the pretext of "upholding public safety", specifically whether conditions were sanitary and whether rats that had previously been living in bushes in the park had been present in the encampment. No evidence was found of a rat problem within the camp. County representatives offered some recommendations but no aid.
+
The [[Alameda County]] Health Department visited the site on October 19, to inspect the camp. No evidence was found of a rat problem within the camp.<ref name=Rats>{{cite news
â   â
There had also been reports of violence and illegal drug use.<ref name=Rats>{{cite news

==== October 20: Notice to vacate====
+
===Notice to Vcate===
â
On October 20, 2011, after accommodating the demonstrators for 10 days, the City of Oakland published an official notice citing "violence, assaults, threats and intimidation", among other complaints, and, forbidding lodging overnight. In the following days, the city continued to issue daily notices of violations in the campsites.<ref>October
+
On October 20, the City of Oakland published an official notice citing "violence, assaults, threats and intimidation", among other complaints, and, forbidding lodging overnight. In the following days, the city continued to issue daily notices of violations in the campsites.<ref>October
[http://www2.oaklandnet.com/oakca/groups/cityadministrator/documents/procedure/oak031803.pdf 20], [http://www.indybay.org/uploads/2011/10/21/occupyoakland_arrestwarning_oak031873.pdf 21], [http://www.indybay.org/uploads/2011/10/22/occupyoakland_arrestwarning-ogawa_102211_oak031875.pdf 22], [http://www.indybay.org/uploads/2011/10/23/occupyoakland_arrestwarning-snow_102311_oak031877.pdf 23], [http://www.indybay.org/uploads/2011/10/24/occupyoakland_arrestwarning-ogawa_1024411_oak031895.pdf 24] 2011 City of Oakland notices</ref><ref>{{cite news|last=McCleese|first=Tihanna|title='Occupy Oakland' protesters given ultimatum|url=http://abclocal.go.com/kgo/story?section=news/local/east_bay&id=8400403|accessdate=October 21, 2011|publisher=KGO|date=October 20, 2011}}</ref> The demonstrators "appeared determined not to leave" and countered that "the rats, drug crimes, and violence in the area of 14th Street and Broadway went unchecked before they arrived." <ref name=not_going>{{cite news|last=Fagan|first=Kevin|title=Occupy Oakland says it's not going anywhere|url=http://www.sfgate.com/cgi-bin/article.cgi?f=/c/a/2011/10/21/BA6S1LKNVB.DTL&tsp=1|accessdate=October 22, 2011|newspaper=San Francisco Chronicle|date=October 22, 2011}}</ref>
[http://www2.oaklandnet.com/oakca/groups/cityadministrator/documents/procedure/oak031803.pdf 20], [http://www.indybay.org/uploads/2011/10/21/occupyoakland_arrestwarning_oak031873.pdf 21], [http://www.indybay.org/uploads/2011/10/22/occupyoakland_arrestwarning-ogawa_102211_oak031875.pdf 22], [http://www.indybay.org/uploads/2011/10/23/occupyoakland_arrestwarning-snow_102311_oak031877.pdf 23], [http://www.indybay.org/uploads/2011/10/24/occupyoakland_arrestwarning-ogawa_1024411_oak031895.pdf 24] 2011 City of Oakland notices</ref><ref>{{cite news|last=McCleese|first=Tihanna|title='Occupy Oakland' protesters given ultimatum|url=http://abclocal.go.com/kgo/story?section=news/local/east_bay&id=8400403|accessdate=October 21, 2011|publisher=KGO|date=October 20, 2011}}</ref> The demonstrators "appeared determined not to leave" and countered that "the rats, drug crimes, and violence in the area of 14th Street and Broadway went unchecked before they arrived." <ref name=not_going>{{cite news|last=Fagan|first=Kevin|title=Occupy Oakland says it's not going anywhere|url=http://www.sfgate.com/cgi-bin/article.cgi?f=/c/a/2011/10/21/BA6S1LKNVB.DTL&tsp=1|accessdate=October 22, 2011|newspaper=San Francisco Chronicle|date=October 22, 2011}}</ref>
